item.description:
The Miraculous Monkey Mind. Learn what ancient Buddhism, modern psychology, and cutting edge neuroscience have to tell us about our minds. How does all of this knowledge help us deal with suffering and the self? What does this mean about human change and the quest to realize our truest potential? This dharma talk and discussion is a forerunner to a one day seminar that will be presented on Saturday, November 6 . This gathering will incorporate music meditation. Presented by Dr. Margaret Petersson.

In addition, we will be offering one of our most popular courses this October, "Discovering Shin Buddhism." One needs to sign up 2 weeks before the class begins. Visit our web site below for more information on this course and other courses offered.

See our CALENDAR @

www.bffct.net

p.s. REMINDER - Hosted by the Buddhist Faith Fellowship. Even though just one or two people from Meetup have RSVPed, you can expect 35 - 45 people in attendance.
